page.title: 18Row of Ashes farm
page.content: This 300 year-old stone farmhouse has a slate roof on an original wooden pegged structure.Some of the original mullioned windows still exist - two bedroom windows were sealed up because of the 1696 window tax.The original underground water cistern still exists - piped water arrived in 1932. The house (and gate piers of 1700) are 'listed'.The farm was originally called Butcombe Farm and owned by Butcombe Court until about 1700. About 10 years ago an archeological teaching excavation investigated a "simple Romano British settlement" and also found pre-historic remains.This summer(1985) a 3-part TV serial was filmed here - to be shown next April. A mother and daughter live in the house.The farm(mostly cattle,wheat and barley) is worked by the son who lives in nearby Row of Ashes cottage.
